intro: Cacalia aphantha, commonly known as the small-flowered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cacalia aphantha is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
